basics.name: Francisco Guerrero
basics.label: Experienced Python Developer and DevOps Engineer
basics.summary: I like to analyze and offer solutions to repetitive tasks. My core competencies lie in backend development although I have ample experience with frontend development. I am responsible, committed to the tasks and I care about testing and documentation with high quality standards.

work.summary: As a DevOps Engineer I am responsible of:
projects: Architecture design for small and medium applications
Setting up CI/CD for testing and production environments with Jenkins
Automation of build and deployment life cycles on test environments with Docker
Automated creation and provision of infrastructure in AWS with Terraform and Packer
Manage AWS resources; EC2, VPC, S3, RDS, ElasticSearch
Implement Jenkins declarative and multibranch pipelines
Deploying python, php and nodejs applications to production environments

work.summary: I've worked in several projects, most of them related with python/django backend development, continuous integration, VMs and containers provisioning and scripts for specific tasks. Here are some highlights:
projects: Deploy and provision web applications on AWS using Ansible
Backend development for a VoIP device provisioning web application in Django
Scrapers for small sites, from which they extract data about a given product, then the data is processed and stored on disk or sent to an REST endpoint
Scripts to automate on-scene arrangement of items, import assets, modify objects, apply textures/materials and render or export the results, all using blender

work.summary: Short experience in which I set up automated testing and continuous integration environments
highlights: Development of a live demonstration that simulates operator's conections and interactions with a callcenter web application
Installation and configuration of a code quality system (Sonarqube), which provides indicators about code coverage and functional tests

work.company: Centro Nacional de Tecnologias de Información
work.summary: Here I started my journey with backend development and django, for about six months I worked on a web app similar to the debian packages index, becoming familiar with the debian ecosystem, policy and guidelines. Over time my interest on platform development grew, given the great potential to reduce time invested on common tasks through integration and automation of many systems.
highlights: The implementation of a continuous integration system to automate software packaging and generation of installable mediums for the distribution Canaima GNU/Linux. This reduced the amount of project configurations, from eight to just one common and static configuration, thus making the maintainer's work a lot easier

work.company: Fundación Bolivariana de Informática y Telemática
work.summary: I worked on I+D and development of educational resources for kids in school age, which goal was to provide full access to the educational content, to children with visual or hearing impairment.
highlights: The integration of a speech synthesis engine to an educational resource, which allowed students with visual impairment to hear all the texts present in it.

education.summary: A broad introduction to machine learning, datamining, and statistical pattern recognition

education.institution: Universidad Nacional Experimental Politécnica de la Fuerza Armada Nacional

projects.name: Sembrando para el futuro
projects.summary: Educational resource for kids in school age
highlights: Its goal is to provide full access to the educational content, to children with visual or hearing impairment
